alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 9:19AM EST until February 25 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Michigan... Sycamore Creek At Holt affecting Ingham County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County. For the Maple River...including Maple Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maple River at Maple Rapids. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of County Line Road and a home along County Line Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EST Saturday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 9.4 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 03/05/1974. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1030 AM EST.
